Page.name: Plants
Page.text: Here you will find informations about harvestable plants

Page.name: Minerals
Page.text: Here you will find informations about harvestable minerals
* indicates minerals that have been discovered, but we
aren't sure how to harvest them or what they are used for
yet. Our scientists are working on it.

Page.name: Ores
Page.text: Here you will find informations about harvestable ores
* indicates ores that have been discovered, but we aren't
sure how to harvest them or what they are used for yet.
Our scientists are working on it.

Page.name: Harv_Other
Page.text: Here you will find informations about other harvestable

Page.name: Stones
Page.text: Here you will find informations about the stones which
can randomly be found while mining ores and minerals.

link.title: Back To the Other Harvestables Index
Back To the Other Harvestables Index

Page.name: Fruit
Page.text: A nutritive treat for most inhabitants of OL.

link.title: Back To the Other Harvestables Index

Page.name: Vegetables
Page.text: A healthy compliment or alternative to cooked meat.

link.title: Back To the Other Harvestables Index

Page.name: Cactus
Page.text: A spiny plant found mainly in arid regions.

Page.name: Sulphur
Page.text: This flammable yellow substance can usually be

Page.name: Coal
Page.text: Formed underground from fossilized plants, this
dark carbon compound is used mainly as a fuel.

Page.name: Quartz
Page.text: This hard mineral can be melted into quality glass.
For a fee, Harvy will make empty vials with it.

Page.name: Blue_Quartz
Page.text: A bluish form of the mineral Quartz.

Page.name: Iron_Ore
Page.text: A strong metal found in a large desert cave.

Page.name: Silver_Ore
Page.text: This underground metal has a wide variety of uses.

Page.name: Gold_Ore
Page.text: This rare precious metal can be found in caves.

Page.name: Emeralds
Page.text: A rare deep-green gemstone found in the depths

Page.name: Sapphires
Page.text: A cool blue gemstone found in the central regions

Page.name: Rubies
Page.text: It takes someone courageous (or well equipped) to

Page.name: Diamonds
Page.text: Only experts can hope to find and successfully
harvest Diamonds - the hardest of the precious

Page.name: Titanium_Ore
Page.text: A metallic element used to make weapons and armor
that are strong, yet very light in weight.

Page.name: Red_Toadstool
Page.text: Restores 10 food points, no cooldown but 5% chance

link.title: Back To the Other Harvestables Index

Page.name: Amber
Page.text: Our scientists are still investigating this mineral.

Page.name: Obsidian
Page.text: Our scientists are still investigating this mineral.

Page.name: Seridium
Page.text: Note: mining this ore requires that you have matter
Every ore mined will consume 1 matter conglomerate.

Page.name: Irilium
Page.text: Our scientists are still investigating this ore.

Page.name: Wolfram
Page.text: A very rare and heavy ore.
Note: mining this ore requires that you have steel long
Every ore mined will consume 1 sword.

Page.name: Yew
Page.text: Used for: No use at this time.

link.title: Back To the Other Harvestables Index

Page.name: Dung
Page.text: Note: this item can be stored only in the Hazardous Items

link.title: Back To the Other Harvestables Index

Page.name: Serpent_Stone
Page.text: Used for making high level items like magic swords.
Also used in some alchemy and summoning recipes.
Note: this stone can rarely be found as a drop from

Page.name: Binding_Stone
Page.text: Used for making high level equipment, like the
most powerful swords, and other items.

Page.name: Rostogol_Stone
Page.text: If you die with this stone in inventory, you won't
drop items (but the stone will disappear).
Note: this stone can rarely be found as a drop from very

Page.name: PP_Removal_Stone
Page.text: These rare stones allow you to remove a pickpoint
from a cross attribute and reallocate it.
Note: there is no stone named "Pickpoint Removal Stone",
there are instead specific stones for every X attribute.
Unlike the other stones, Pickpoint Removal Stones can
also be found while harvesting plants.
